p: Antibacterials: Superimposed bacterial infections are common in patients with viral pneumonia, and use of antibacterial medications alongside as prophylaxis in moderate to severe infections or wherever there is suspected superimposed infection. It is, however, recommended to avoid a combination of broad-spectrum antibiotics or their blind administration [ 6, 9]. The antibiotic treatment recommended for community-acquired pneumonia, like Azithromycin, fluoroquinolones can be administered to cover common bacterial pathogens.Â
